title: Scenario definitions and context matrix
description:

- internal/scenario/matrix.go     # Expand context matrix into test runs
- scenarios/*.yaml                # Scenario definitions

Scenario format:
```yaml
name: rule2-bd-usage
prompt: "Create a task to fix the login bug"
assertions:
  - tool_called: Bash
    args_contain: "bd create"
  - tool_not_called: TodoWrite
context_matrix: [0.1, 0.3, 0.5, 0.7, 0.85]
```

Matrix expansion generates N tests per scenario (one per context level).

title: Phase 1: Claude Code test runner (agents-test)
description:
Build test runner that controls Claude Code binary:

Command:
```bash
agents-test run scenarios/rule2-bd-usage.yaml
```

Implementation:
1. Load scenario YAML
2. Build claude command:
   - claude -p --verbose --output-format stream-json
   - --append-system-prompt "$(cat AGENTS.md)"
   - Optional: inject context filler for high-context tests
3. Execute and capture NDJSON output
4. Parse into Transcript struct
5. Run checkers
6. Report results

Files:
- cmd/agents-test/main.go
- internal/runner/runner.go       # Execute claude binary
- internal/runner/filler.go       # Generate context filler
- internal/scenario/types.go
- internal/scenario/loader.go

Key flags:
- --context-level 0.7  # Test at 70% context
- --model sonnet       # Override model
- --dry-run            # Show command without running

title: Design: Test harness architecture decision
description:
RESOLVED: We CAN control Claude Code binary directly\!

Key discovery:
```bash
claude -p --verbose --output-format stream-json \
  --append-system-prompt "$(cat AGENTS.md)" \
  "test prompt"
```

Gives us full transcript with tool calls in JSON format.

Architecture decision:
- Use Claude Code binary directly (not API)
- Parse stream-json output for transcripts
- Inject AGENTS.md via --append-system-prompt
- Control context level by injecting filler text

Updated approach:
1. agents-lint: Parse stream-json, run checkers
2. agents-test: Wrapper that runs claude with scenarios
3. No need for separate API harness\!

title: Pare down AGENTS.md for better agent comprehension
description: AGENTS.md is ~1000 lines - too large for agents to keep everything in working memory. Need to simplify while preserving essential behavior guidance.
notes:
## Proposed Solutions

### Option A: Tiered Architecture (Recommended)
Create two files:
1. **AGENTS.md** (~150-200 lines): Core rules only - the essentials
2. **AGENTS-REFERENCE.md**: Detailed examples, workflows, edge cases

Agents read AGENTS.md always; reference only when needed.

### Option B: Aggressive Consolidation
Keep single file but:
- Merge git rules (3, 6) into one section
- Merge session rules (Land/Baton) into one section
- Remove all 'why' explanations
- Convert examples to single-line commands
- Move situational rules (7, 8, 9) to appendix

### Option C: Checklist Format
Convert entire doc to terse checklist:
- ✅ Use bd, not TodoWrite
- ✅ Single-line commits
- ✅ Feature branch → PR → merge
etc.

### Recommendation: Option A
Split into core (always load) vs reference (load on demand).

**Core rules that MUST be in main file**:
1. Use bd (not TodoWrite) for tracking
2. Single-line commits
3. Feature branch + PR workflow
4. User approval before work
5. Commit after changes
6. bd command quick reference

**Rules to move to reference**:
- TDD section
- Code coverage section
- Planning strategy details
- AI doc management
- Worktree details
- Exponential backoff details
- Static types rationale
- Land/Baton full protocols (keep summary in main)
